definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: China Southern Airlines opened several check in counters.
sentences.chinese: 中国南方航空公司在这里开设了几个值机台。

sentences.english: You should check in at Counter No. 18.
sentences.chinese: 您乘坐的航班在值机18号柜台办理乘机手续。

sentences.english: You can get the boarding card at the check-in counter over there.
sentences.chinese: 您可以在那边的值机柜台取您的登机牌。

sentences.english: You can check in any flight of HNA on the same day at Counter 15.
sentences.chinese: 您在15号值机柜台可以办理海航当日任意航班。

sentences.english: Would you please check in your flight at the check-in counter .
sentences.chinese: 请您到值机柜台办理所乘航班的乘机手续。

sentences.english: It is not allowed that different passengers use same ID number.
sentences.chinese: 如今体系不支持多个游客用同一身份证订票的值机。

definition: luggage that has been checked in (on flight)
to inspect a ticket/to examine a ballot
scheduled flight/flight number/plane/scheduled sailing/sailing number/passenger ship
to change one's reservation/to transfer to a different flight, airline, bus or train
